description:
Whether you’re whipping up a traditional gumbo or dirty rice, or your favorite chicken and rice casserole, Market Pantry delivers quick, delicious rice. You can serve a jazzed up meal you can feel good about, just boil, fluff and serve!
Directions

Stovetop:
1. Combine rice, water, salt and butter in saucepan.
2. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover.
3. Simmer 45 to 50 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork and serve.

2 Servings: 1/2 cup rice; 1-1/4 cups water; 1/4 tsp. salt (optional); 1 tsp. butter (optional).
4 Servings: 1 cup rice; 2 cups water; 1/2 tsp. salt (optional); 2 tsp. butter (optional).
6 Servings: 1-1/2 cup rice; 3 cups water; 3/4 tsp. salt (optional); 1 tbsp. butter (optional).
10 Servings: entire bag rice; 5 cups water; 1 tsp. salt (optional); 2 tbsp. butter (optional).

Rice Cooker or Steamer:
1. Combine rice, water, salt and butter in rice cooker (Use the rice cooker measuring cup; using another measuring cup may product slight variations in the cooked rice.) or steamer.
2. Follow the rice cooker or steamer manufacturer's instructions.

Tip - For firmer rice, use less water and reduce cooking time. For softer rice, use more water and increase cooking time.

description:
Long grain white rice, onions, and bell peppers with traditional New Orleans seasonings. So when you want great flavor, jazz it up with Zatarain's!

Directions
Stove top:
1. Mix 2-1/2 cups water, Rice Mix, meat of your choice and 1 tbsp. vegetable or olive oil (optional) in 3-quart saucepan until well blended. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover.
2. Simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender.
3. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving.

Microwave:
1. Mix 2-1/2 cups hot water, Rice Mix, meat of your choice (Add cooked shrimp during last 5 minutes of cooking time.) and 1 tbsp. vegetable or olive oil (optional) in 2-1/2-quart microwavable bowl until well blended. Cover.
2. Microwave on high 5 minutes. Stir. Microwave on medium (50% power) 18 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Let stand in microwave 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. Microwave ovens vary; adjust cooking times as needed. Cooking times are based on an 1100 watt microwave oven. Caution: Bowl and contents will be very hot. Use pot holders when removing from microwave.

description:
Minute Ready to Serve Rice is delicious, convenient and perfectly portioned; and it's ready in just 60 seconds. Fully cooked, nothing to add. Great for quick and easy meals at work or home.

Directions:

Measurements:
2 Servings: 1 cup rice, 1 cup water;
4 Servings: 2 cups rice, 1-3/4 cups water;
6 Servings: 3 cups rice, 2-1/2 cups water;
8 Servings: 4 cups rice, 3 cups water. 1/2 cup uncooked rice = 1 serving (about 2/3 cup cooked rice).

Saucepan:
1. Bring water to a boil (If desired, add butter and salt to taste.). 2. Stir in rice; return to boil. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes. 3. Remove from heat and stir; cover. Let stand 5 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with fork.

Microwave:
1. Place water and rice in microwave-safe bowl (If desired, add butter and salt to taste.) 2. Cover and microwave on high. Microwave Cook Times: 2 Servings, 7 minutes; 4 servings, 9 minutes; 6 servings, 12 minutes. 3. Let stand 5 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Microwave ovens vary. Cooking times are approximate.

description:
This easy-to-prepare rice dish has just the right blend of ingredients for great-tasting, authentic New Orleans style meal.

Directions
Easy Stove Top:
1. In a two quart saucepan, combine 1-1/2 cups water, 15 oz can diced tomatoes (crushed), 1 tablespoon butter or margarine and Zatarain's Spanish Rice mix. Stir well and bring to boil.
2. Stir, reduce heat, cover and simmer over Low heat for 25 minutes or until all water is absorbed.
3. Remove from heat, let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff and serve.

Microwave:
1. In a 2-1/2 quart microwave- safe bowl, combine 1-1/2 cups hot water, 15 oz can crushed diced tomatoes, 1 tablespoon butter or margarine (optional) and Zatarain's Spanish Rice mix and stir thoroughly.
2. Cover and cook on High for 5 minutes, stir and reduce power to 60% and cook for approximately 16 minutes (Cook time may differ depending on the powder of the microwave oven), stirring occasionally.
3. Remove, stir and let stand covered for 5 minutes before serving.

The slight crunchiness of red quinoa perfectly complements the chewiness of brown rice for a product that is as colorful as it is versatile. What is Quinoa? Quinoa is a “pseudo-grain," or a seed that resembles a grain and is cooked in the same way. It has the perfect balance of all nine amino acids essential for human nutrition, making it a complete protein. While available in a variety of colors, quinoa is most commonly available in hues of red, white, and black.

description:
Mahatma Whole Grain Brown Rice is a great addition to the table. Eat it plain or add chicken and vegetables to make a healthy and filling meal.


Directions:

Microwave:
1. Combine 1 cup brown rice and 3 cups water in a 2-1/2 quart microwave-safe dish. 2. Microwave uncovered on high for 10 minutes. 3. Reduce power to 50%, microwave uncovered for 20 minutes. 4. Allow rice to sit for 5 minutes. 5. Fluff with a fork and serve. Do not add salt or butter/margarine to the rice until after the rice is cooked. Note: These directions are based on cooking in an 1100 Watt microwave oven only. Cooking in a higher power microwave oven is not recommended. Cooking in a lower power microwave oven requires a longer time to cook. If your microwave does not have variable power settings follow manufacturer's directions. Brown Rice Storage: For longer shelf life we recommend storing brown rice in the refrigerator or freezer.

Stove top:
1. In saucepan, bring water to a boil (Cooking Measurement Chart: For drier rice, use 1 /4 cup less water. For moister rice, use 1/4 cup more water. 5 - 3/4 cup cooked servings = 1 cup rice, 2-1/2 cups water, makes 3-1/2 cups; 9 ; 14 - 3/4 cup cooked servings = 3 cups rice, 7-1/2 cups water, makes 10-1/2 cups). 2. Stir in rice (Add 1 tbsp tub margarine and 1 tsp salt per cup of uncooked rice, if desired). 3. Cover. Reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes or until all water is absorbed.
For Cooking Rice in Excess Water: To prepare up to 2 cups of brown rice, bring 10 cups of water to a boil. Stir in rice. Return to a boil. Cook uncovered for 30 minutes. Drain water. Serve. 1 tablespoon tub margarine and 1 teaspoon salt per cup of rice can be added to the water while cooking, if desired.

description:

Directions
Stove Top Directions:
1. Mix 2-1/2 cups water, rice mix and 2 tbsp. butter, margarine or olive oil in 2-quart saucepan until well blended. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover.
2. Simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent rice and beans from sticking.
3. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. Serving Suggestion: Add a half pound of sliced sausage to make a complete meal.

Microwave Directions:
1. Mix 2-1/2 cups hot water, rice mix and 2 tbsp. butter, margarine or olive oil in 2-1/2-quart microwavable bowl until well blended. Cover.
2. Microwave on high 5 minutes. Stir. Microwave on medium (50% power) 18 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Let stand in microwave 5 minutes. Fluff with fork before serving. Microwave ovens vary; adjust cooking times as needed. Cooking times are based on an 1100 watt microwave oven. Caution: Bowl and contents will be very hot. Use pot holders when removing from microwave.

Directions
Stove Top:

Rice Cooker:

Hinode Calrose White rice is a sticky, japonica variety that has thrived in Mediterranean climates for thousands of years. It is a staple part of meals prepared daily throughout the Pacific.

Directions
Rice Cooker:
1. Follow the rice cooker directions or use the rice measurement chart below. 2. Optional: rinse rice in water until water becomes clear. 3. Add rice and water to cooker and stir well. 4. Close lid and start rice cooker. Use white rice setting if available. 5. Rice is ready when rice cooker switches to warm setting. Fluff and serve. Note: Rice to water ratio varies by rice cooker.

Stove Top:
1 Find desired servings in rice measurement chart below. 2. Optional: rinse rice in water until water becomes clear. 3. Bring water to boil in a saucepan. 4. Stir in rice, cover with lid, and simmer on low for 15-20 minutes or until moisture is absorbed. 5. Remove from heat, fluff and serve. Note: For softer rice add 1/4 cup more water and cook for 5 minutes longer. For firmer rice add 1/4 cup less water and cook for 5 minutes less.

Rice Measurement Chart:
2 cups uncooked rice and 3 cups water yields 6 cups cooked rice.
3 cups uncooked rice and 4-1/2 cups water yields 9 cups cooked rice.
4 cups uncooked rice and 6 cups water yields 12 cups cooked rice.

description:
Uncle Ben's Natural Whole Grain Instant Brown Rice supports a healthy heart and a well balanced diet. It's high on taste.

Directions
Measurements:
2 Servings (2 cups of cooked rice): 1/2 cup rice, 1 cup water, 1 tsp butter (optional);
4 Servings (1 cup of cooked rice): 1 cup rice, 1-3/4 cups water, 2 tsp butter (optional);
6 Servings (6 cups of cooked rice): 1-1/2 cups rice, 2-1/2 cups water, 1 tbsp butter (optional);
8 Servings (8 cups of cooked rice): whole box rice, 3-1/4 cups water, 1 tbsp butter (optional).

Stovetop (Preferred Method):
1: Combine rice, water and butter (optional) in a saucepan.
2: Bring to a boil. Reduce heat (medium-low to medium) and cover.
3: Simmer 10-12 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with fork and serve.

Microwave:
1. Cut open pouch.
2. In a 2.5-qt saucepan boil 4 cups of water with desired amount of rice (use 6 cups of water when cooking the whole box of rice).
3. Boil gently for 10-12 minutes or until rice is tender.
4. Drain into mesh strainer. Fluff with fork and serve.

Microwave:
1. Combine rice, water and butter (optional) in a microwave-safe glass bowl.
2. Cover tightly with microwave-safe lid or plastic wrap and cook on high using times below: 4 Servings: 8 minutes; 6 Servings: 10 minutes; 8 Servings: 12 minutes.
3. Reduce to medium (50%) for 5 minutes. Remove from microwave. Let stand covered 3-5 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with fork and serve. Microwave ovens vary. Cooking times are approximate. Adjust cooking time as needed. For Best Results: For firmer rice, use less water and reduce cooking time. For softer rice, use more water and increase cooking time.
